{"step_by_step_thinking": "Oseltamivir, also known as Tamiflu, is an antiviral medication used to treat and prevent influenza A and B. According to Document [6], oseltamivir is an antiviral neuraminidase inhibitor. This means it works by blocking the function of the viral neuraminidase protein, which is necessary for viral replication. This is further confirmed by Document [22], which states that oseltamivir is a neuraminidase inhibitor and it prevents new viral particles from being released.", "answer_choice": "B"}
